page.title: 14Royston Church Painting
page.content: A 19th C. painting of Royston Parish Church was auctioned at Christies as part of a collection of important English pictures.The painting remains a mystery. Neither Christies or the local clergy know who painted it or when. Rev.John Hudson described the painting as an "exciting find" particularly during the 750th anniversary of the parish.The painting measures 22"by 30". It shows the front view of the church and the graveyard and has two children feeding geese in the foreground. A local historian has dated the painting at about 1820 to 1840. Fortunately the painting did not leave the area.It was bought at Christies by a local lady as a surprise birthday gift for her husband.It was valued between Â£3-4,000 and the lady said she was very happy with the auction price of just Â£3500.
